Choosing the best Workout Videos



Trying to find the best workout video can be a difficult process.

That process does not have to be difficult when we focus positively on our goals. Apathy, usually a big hindrance, can play a big part in starting a workout routine. It is always safer to find an excuse not to exercise rather than focusing to get out there and start a program. How often have you said "I don't have the time, inch or "the gym is not close enough to home, inch or "the weather is bad today. inch Discomfort used these excuses before, I believe. To overcome these obstacles a really good solution to get healthy and fit is to exercise at home, using a good workout video. By using a good DVD workout video you can exercise in your own surroundings, without the expense of gym membership and expensive equipment. There are many excellent workout videos out there today, but what is the best workout video? There seems to be a new workout video out in the market on a every week basis. These include dance exercise videos, workouts for men and women. They all have one thing in keeping. They promise to get you fit, toned, muscular and healthy. Many of them use famous celebrities or have the latest and greatest fitness master in their promotion. The intention of this article is to help you make an informed choice when looking for the best workout videos for your home work out program.

What Goals Do you have?

A vital the main selection process is to set out what you are looking for. Is it an increased fitness level you are after? Are you trying to get toned abs for that holiday that is coming up? Have you just had a child and want to shed those last few pounds of "preggy fat"? Various workout videos promise various fitness solutions and while they may state they have everything, you should make your choice after you decide what your goal is. The right Atmosphere When choosing the best workout videos for you, the right atmosphere is important. You should always train in an environment that is comfortable and makes the workout fun. The type of trainer in the video can play a big part in this.

Do you enjoy the "party approach, inch where the instructor creates an event involving people of various genders, ages and abilities? Or there is the "one on one" style of workout video. These are more focused on just you and the trainer and many of the "celebrity" workout videos use this format. This type of video is a lot more like having your own private trainer and is more serious and focused than the "party approach. inch

There is a different type of workout video where you can follow a serious, focused exercise routine, while the trainer involves others while he or she shows you the moves. This type of routine is, in my opinion, one of the best workout videos you could choose.

The P90X2 program is just this type of work out program.

The P90X2 program is a combination of weight training and plyometrics. This includes doing weighted squats, and following that with some lift advances. This method had been employed by many of the best athletes around the world to improve their fitness, with amazing results.

P90X2, the much looked forward to sequel to the hugely successful P90X program uses the same tried and tested philosophies that have proven to work to achieve better overall fitness and muscle tone. This series of videos will push you right but the trainer, A2z tony Horton, will keep you focused on getting the results you desire. By far this work out program is one of the best workout videos you can purchase available today.

Create Videos From your Articles


Last Sunday, 16 September 2010 (Manila Time) I come across a software that its endorsers say turns articles into videos in a few clicks. I was pleased not only for how clever the software ended up being, but also because I was--at that precise time--looking for a way of creating a video out of my PowerPoint presentation.

Aside from being an online enthusiast, I am also a social development consultant. I presently work for GTZ International Services as a Long term Expert (as Deputy Procurement Specialist). The GTZ IS had been shortened by the Western european Commission to provide Technical Assist with the health Sector Policy Support Program in the Philippines.

I had been tasked to provide the Program's Procurement Status Report in the Public Finance Management Class that would be conducted in two days, on 20 September 2010. So i was in a hurry to produce my video presentation. Class participants included key officials of the national and local governments, including Cabinet Secretaries and Provincial Governors. Representatives of the european union, the world Bank, and oversight agencies like the Commission and Audit, National Economic Development Authority, and the Department of Budget and Management, would also be present. Used to do not want to be sloppy during the presentation.

A week earlier around my supplements for the presentation, I aquired a software that turns powerpoint presentations to flash. It cost me USD forty nine. The software is easy to use. You just run the slide show of the presentation and read (to the mic of the computer) the written text of the presentation as you move from slide to slide. This provides the audio of the PowerPoint presentation. When the audio recording was done, I saved the file into the flash format supported by the software.

The software works okay. But the problem was I had a really pronunciation that -- while reviewing the flash presentation -- left me less than delighted by the result. The content of the presentation was, in my view, impeccable. I needed something more elegant for its delivery.

I researched the internet for freelancing of the voice over content of my report. Three carrier's networks responded to my job offer. Their track records were quiet impressive (they provided me with examples of their previous works). My problem was the cost. The lowest bidder charged USD 25 per 30 seconds of the running video. I reckoned that my presentation would run for not less than 5 minutes in its entirety, so that would have meant spending at least USD 750 for the outsourced service provider.

It was a difficult decision, but I was about to advise the service provider (he committed to deliver in 8 hours after receipt of acceptance of bid offer) that the freelancing job was on. And then, while still on online search mode, I ran across this website that churns out articles into videos. Surprised? Pleased? Like I said earlier, I was both surprised and pleased.

I wasted no time in becoming a member of its 14-day free trial. After discussing the online site's getting started video lessons, I begun to work on my presentation. There were a few clicks on the "refresh" and "back" buttons (first time Used to do this kind of stuff), but in a turn of events that flatly amazed me (must have been lucky that day! )#) my work was done in under two hours. (I promise you I can create videos from my articles in less time from hereon in. It's also fun! )#)

If you want to take a look at my beginner's "masterpiece", you may scroll down and play the video (otherwise you may just read on if you would rather want to find it some other time).
